job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Granville, OH
pros: Small, collegial, great students, excellent health benefits, campus is pretty and safe. Pays well as far as NTT salaries go. Small class sizes.
cons: Adjunctification is on the rise, administration pours money/TT lines into "sexy" new departments while letting some older core departments languish and become less robust by forcing them to meet unchanged or rising teaching demand with NTT faculty. Typical sexist/racist problems of overload for NTT, female, GNC/trans, and BIPoc faculty and staff. Typical NTT contract precarity. Significant commute from nearest major city.

pros: the mission of this liberal arts school is strong and important. our facility and students are top tier
cons: management has been chasing everyone out with their inability to lead. they blame the departures on "the great resignation" but the truth is that it's a culture of fear and discipline for any minor infraction. if you are interviewing here, as what the turnover rate is, and why.

review_title: The greatest successes and challenges of my professional career.
pros: The intellectual, social, and intentional vibe of the campus culture. The heartfelt dedication of the faculty. A solid senior staff and board of trustees. The ability to be a professional without being micromanaged. A fairly relaxed working environment that easily allows for your personal needs as long as professional expectations are being met. An impressively connected and accomplished alumni body. Free and indoor parking.
cons: The occasional conflicting/vague messages or priorities. The lack of a clear institutional identity or operational strategy. A "country club" treatment of students (who don't always appreciate what they have) -- although that's increasingly necessary for competitiveness.

pros: Amazing work environment that allows you to work on your own ideas; a lot of great benefits; very intelligent students; fair amount of paid time off; very friendly colleagues
cons: Not a very diverse staff but could be due to location; about 30-40 minutes away from Columbus; hard to balance work-life balance, everyone is expected to be very involved with campus life; not a lot of opportunities to move-up unless you invest a lot of years to Denison.

pros: Great environment, beautiful campus. Pay isn't particularly competitive for education level. Academics are self centered, self important and centered on trying to prove how smart they are to anyone who will listen. The working staff is a wonderful group of people.
cons: No benefits to working part time, low pay for education level. Depending on what department you get on with, your life can be a living hell.

job_title: Admissions Student Worker in Granville, OH
pros: Each of the employers I have had has been friendly, helpful, and genuinely concerned about my well-being. This has helped me to be productive and motivated despite the time commitment of concurrently being a full-time student.
cons: Workload and communication levels vary incredibly depending on the department of the university for which you work. Some positions involve little interaction or activity.

job_title: Athletic Facilities Student Supervisor in Chicago, IL
pros: Decent hours, limited responsibility, and overall a nice gig.  You can homework while you sign people in, it's the easiest job you can do.
cons: Pay is low (minimum wage), but really you're getting paid to do your homework.  So how could you really be upset?

pros: Lots of opportunities to get involved beyond your school work, the tour guide position is a great way to practice public speaking, sales, and thinking on your feet.
cons: Jobs at Denison do not always give as many hours as one might desire, as a tour guide there are many slow times, and picking up additional hours may not be possible

review_title: A Great Place to Work Part time
job_title: Writing Center Consultant in Granville, OH
pros: Pros are flexible hours (very flexible), great co-workers, very interesting work. Ability to schedule hours as you want is awesome!
cons: The bosses can be pretty obnoxious; particularly how they make you attend meetings every two weeks (usually really early in the morning). Which wouldn't be that bad except that nothing gets done in the meetings.

review_title: Good interesting work, harder than other jobs at same level
job_title: Student Network Consultant in Granville, OH
pros:
Learn a lot and can actually talk about what you did when this goes on your resume.
Great bonuses in free meals every so often, easy to work around schedules when classes get tough.
cons: Do a lot more work than people at other on-campus jobs, and earn the same amount of pay.

review_title: extremely valuable experience as a student workers

cons: 20 hrs of work biweekly maximum for the majority of the student workers was always a large obstacle to work around, especially if a project required  extra time to work on.

pros: Fantastic way to earn money as a student at Denison. The coaches and players are great, and being outside on the job is really nice.
cons: It can be fairly time consuming, but you're able to log those hours to make up a pretty substantial paycheck.

pros: I loved my one boss. She made work nice but it was who she was that made that place special.
cons: There was a lot to do outside of that job. Honestly the job was boring but I found a way to make it work.

pros: Good pay and benefits, sometimes fun, you never know what you will see, there are some good kids there,

review_title: It's been a good marriage ... a few bumps along the way but, overall, a pretty good gig.
